abstract.text: Creates a set of properties for a virtual device.

inlineContent.text: A catch-all for uncommon or device specific properties that arenâ€™t listed above. This parameter is typically only for advanced users that need additional control over device functionality.
Properties must be specified during the creation of a virtual device using

abstract.text: Interact with keyboards, mice, and other human interface devices.
Use and interact with a virtual human interface device for testing and development.
The localization codes that some HID devices declare to specify conformance to a certain format or language.
Common transport types that transmit data to or from a HID device.
A virtual service to emulate a HID device connected to the system.
The properties for a virtual HID device.
The HID specification compliant report descriptor for the virtual device.
Creates a set of properties for a virtual device.
A device localization code that specifies the HID compliant localization code.
The location ID for the device.
The manufacturer of the device.
The model number for the device.
The product name for the device.
The product ID for the device.
The serial number for the device.
The data transport for the device.
A unique ID for the device.
The vendor ID for the device.
The version of the device.
Creates a virtual HID device.
A byte buffer in memory.
A collection whose elements are key-value pairs.
A Unicode string value that is a collection of characters.
A 32-bit unsigned integer value type.
A 64-bit unsigned integer value type.
The protocol to which all classes implicitly conform.
